bill.title: Emergency Medical Services; transfer EMS program responsibilities to Department of Public Safety.
bill.description: An Act To Transfer The Powers And Responsibility Of The Division Of Emergency Medical Services Of The State Department Of Health To The Mississippi Department Of Public Safety Division Of Emergency Medical Services; To Provide For A Director Of The Department Of Public Safety Division Of Emergency Medical Services; To Provide For The Membership Of The Emergency Medical Services And Systems Of Care Advisory Council; To Amend Sections 45-1-2, 41-59-3, 41-59-5, 41-59-7, 41-59-9, 41-59-11, 41-59-13, 41-59-15, 41-59-17, 41-59-19, 41-59-23, 41-59-25, 41-59-27, 41-59-31, 41-59-33, 41-59-35, 41-59-37, 41-59-39, 41-59-41, 41-59-45, 41-59-47, 41-59-49, 41-59-61, 41-59-63, 41-59-65, 41-59-67, 41-59-69, 41-59-75, 41-59-77, 41-59-79, 41-59-81, 41-60-11 And 41-60-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer Certain Functions Of The State Department Of Health Relating To Emergency Medical Services And Emergency Medical Technicians To The Department Of Public Safety Division Of Emergency Medical Services In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 25-9-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For A Period Of Two Years The Personnel Actions Of The State Department Of Health Division Of Emergency Medical Services Shall Be Exempt From State Personnel Board Procedures, And All Employees Of Such Agencies Shall Be Classified As Nonstate Service During That Period; And For Related Purposes.

step.action: Referred To Public Health and Welfare
